22 March 2017 Can data save rhinos? How to attack wildlife crime at source By the time surveillance technology catches a poacher, it's already too late. Can new methods (below) tackle the problem at its source? Xinhua/Rachen Sageamsak/eyevine 
THREE days after World Wildlife Day, poachers broke into a French zoo not far from Paris, made their way to an enclosure that housed a white rhino called Vince, shot him three times in the head and used a chainsaw to detach his horn . The poachers got away despite there being five members of staff living on the premises and plenty of security cameras .
